meanings.definition: The state or capacity of being everywhere at the same time; omnipresence.
meanings.sent1: The ubiquity of technology in our daily lives is undeniable.
meanings.sent2: The ubiquity of fast food restaurants makes it easy to grab a quick meal.
meanings.sent3: His claim of having the ubiquity of a superhero was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The ubiquity of gossip spread through the office like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The ubiquity of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being widespread or constantly encountered.
meanings.sent1: The ubiquity of advertisements can be overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The ubiquity of smartphones has changed how we communicate.
meanings.sent3: The ubiquity of his jokes made him the life of the party.
meanings.sent4: The ubiquity of kindness in her actions was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The ubiquity of traffic in the city was frustrating for commuters.
